definition: the indefinite continued progress of existence and events
a period of 365 or 366 days, in the Gregorian calendar, divided into 12 months
human beings in general or considered collectively
a method, style, or manner of doing something
a period of 24 hours as a unit of time
an adult human male
an object that one need not, cannot, or does not wish to give a specific name to
an adult human female
the existence of an individual human being or animal
a young human being below the age of puberty or below the legal age of majority
the earth, together with all of its countries, peoples, and natural features
an institution for educating children
a nation or territory considered as an organized political community under one government
a group consisting of parents and children living together in a household
a person who is studying at a school or college
a number of people or things that are located, gathered, or classed together
a nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory
a matter or situation regarded as unwelcome or harmful and needing to be dealt with and overcome
the end part of a person's arm beyond the wrist, including the palm, fingers, and thumb
a piece or segment of something such as an object, activity, or period of time, which combined with other pieces makes up the whole
a particular position, point, or area in space; a location
an instance of a particular situation; an example of something occurring
a period of seven days
a commercial business
a set of connected things or parts forming a complex whole, in particular
a planned series of future events, items, or performances
a sentence worded or expressed so as to elicit information
activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a purpose or result
the governing body of a nation, state, or community
an arithmetical value, expressed by a word, symbol, or figure, representing a particular quantity and used in counting and making calculations
the period of darkness in each twenty-four hours; the time from sunset to sunrise
a particular spot, place, or position in an area or on a map, object, or surface
the place where one lives permanently, especially as a member of a family or household
a colorless, transparent, odorless, tasteless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain and is the basis of the fluids of living organisms
space that can be occupied or where something can be done, especially viewed in terms of whether there is enough
a woman in relation to her child or children
a region or part of a town, a country, or the world
a current medium of exchange in the form of coins and banknotes; coins and banknotes collectively
an account of imaginary or real people and events told for entertainment
a thing that is known or proved to be true
each of the twelve named periods into which a year is divided
a particular group or set of people or things
that which is morally correct, just, or honorable
the devotion of time and attention to acquiring knowledge on an academic subject, especially by means of books
a written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side and bound in covers
each of a pair of globular organs of sight in the head of humans and vertebrate animals
a paid position of regular employment
a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used with others (or sometimes alone) to form a sentence and typically shown with a space on either side when written or printed
a person's regular occupation, profession, or trade
an important topic or problem for debate or discussion
a position to the left or right of an object, place, or central point
a group of people or things having similar characteristics
the upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs
a building for human habitation, especially one that is lived in by a family or small group of people
the action of helping or doing work for someone
a person whom one knows and with whom one has a bond of mutual affection, typically exclusive of sexual or family relations
a man in relation to his child or children
the ability or capacity to do something or act in a particular way
a period of time equal to a twenty-fourth part of a day and night and divided into 60 minutes
a form of play or sport, especially a competitive one played according to rules and decided by skill, strength, or luck
a long, narrow mark or band
the final part of something, especially a period of time, an activity, or a story
a person, animal, or plant belonging to a particular group
the system of rules which a particular country or community recognizes as regulating the actions of its members and which it may enforce by the imposition of penalties
a road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine and able to carry a small number of people
a large town
a group of people living in the same place or having a particular characteristic in common
a word or set of words by which a person or thing is known, addressed, or referred to
the elected head of a republican state
a group of players forming one side in a competitive game or sport
a period of time equal to sixty seconds or a sixtieth of an hour
a thought or suggestion as to a possible course of action
a child or young person
the physical structure of a person or an animal, including the bones, flesh, and organs
facts provided or learned about something or someone
the rear surface of the human body from the shoulders to the hips
